inputs.name: hasPart
inputs.label: Has Part
inputs.help: Part of a Dataset

inputs.name: title
inputs.label: Title
inputs.help: The main title of the Dataset

inputs.name: subtitle
inputs.label: Subtitle
inputs.help: A secondary title that amplifies or states certain limitations on the main title

inputs.name: alternativeTitle
inputs.label: Alternative Title
inputs.help: Either 1) a title commonly used to refer to the Dataset or 2) an abbreviation of the main title

inputs.name: alternativeURL
inputs.label: Alternative URL
inputs.help: Another URL where one can view or access the data in the Dataset, e.g. a project or personal webpage

inputs.name: otherId
inputs.label: Other Identifier
inputs.help: Another unique identifier for the Dataset (e.g. producer's or another repository's identifier)

inputs.name: author
inputs.label: Author
inputs.help: The entity, e.g. a person or organization, that created the Dataset

inputs.name: datasetContact
inputs.label: Point of Contact
inputs.help: The entity, e.g. a person or organization, that users of the Dataset can contact with questions

inputs.name: dsDescription
inputs.label: Description
inputs.help: A summary describing the purpose, nature, and scope of the Dataset

inputs.name: subject
inputs.label: Subject
inputs.help: The area of study relevant to the Dataset

inputs.name: keyword
inputs.label: Keyword
inputs.help: A key term that describes an important aspect of the Dataset and information about any controlled vocabulary used

inputs.name: topicClassification
inputs.label: Topic Classification
inputs.help: Indicates a broad, important topic or subject that the Dataset covers and information about any controlled vocabulary used

inputs.name: publication
inputs.label: Related Publication
inputs.help: The article or report that uses the data in the Dataset. The full list of related publications will be displayed on the metadata tab

inputs.name: notesText
inputs.label: Notes
inputs.help: Additional information about the Dataset

inputs.name: language
inputs.label: Language
inputs.help: A language that the Dataset's files is written in

inputs.name: producer
inputs.label: Producer
inputs.help: The entity, such a person or organization, managing the finances or other administrative processes involved in the creation of the Dataset

inputs.name: productionDate
inputs.label: Production Date
inputs.help: The date when the data were produced (not distributed, published, or archived)

inputs.name: productionPlace
inputs.label: Production Location
inputs.help: The location where the data and any related materials were produced or collected

inputs.name: contributor
inputs.label: Contributor
inputs.help: The entity, such as a person or organization, responsible for collecting, managing, or otherwise contributing to the development of the Dataset

inputs.name: grantNumber
inputs.label: Funding Information
inputs.help: Information about the Dataset's financial support

inputs.name: distributor
inputs.label: Distributor
inputs.help: The entity, such as a person or organization, designated to generate copies of the Dataset, including any editions or revisions

inputs.name: distributionDate
inputs.label: Distribution Date
inputs.help: The date when the Dataset was made available for distribution/presentation

inputs.name: depositor
inputs.label: Depositor
inputs.help: The entity, such as a person or organization, that deposited the Dataset in the repository

inputs.name: dateOfDeposit
inputs.label: Deposit Date
inputs.help: The date when the Dataset was deposited into the repository

inputs.name: timePeriodCovered
inputs.label: Time Period
inputs.help: The time period that the data refer to. Also known as span. This is the time period covered by the data, not the dates of coding, collecting data, or making documents machine-readable

inputs.name: dateOfCollection
inputs.label: Date of Collection
inputs.help: The dates when the data were collected or generated

inputs.name: kindOfData
inputs.label: Data Type
inputs.help: The type of data included in the files (e.g. survey data, clinical data, or machine-readable text)

inputs.name: series
inputs.label: Series
inputs.help: Information about the dataset series to which the Dataset belong

inputs.name: software
inputs.label: Software
inputs.help: Information about the software used to generate the Dataset

inputs.name: relatedMaterial
inputs.label: Related Material
inputs.help: Information, such as a persistent ID or citation, about the material related to the Dataset, such as appendices or sampling information available outside of the Dataset

inputs.name: relatedDatasets
inputs.label: Related Dataset
inputs.help: Information, such as a persistent ID or citation, about a related dataset, such as previous research on the Dataset's subject

inputs.name: otherReferences
inputs.label: Other Reference
inputs.help: Information, such as a persistent ID or citation, about another type of resource that provides background or supporting material to the Dataset

inputs.name: dataSources
inputs.label: Data Source
inputs.help: Information, such as a persistent ID or citation, about sources of the Dataset (e.g. a book, article, serial, or machine-readable data file)

inputs.name: originOfSources
inputs.label: Origin of Historical Sources
inputs.help: For historical sources, the origin and any rules followed in establishing them as sources

inputs.name: characteristicOfSources
inputs.label: Characteristic of Sources
inputs.help: Characteristics not already noted elsewhere

inputs.name: accessToSources
inputs.label: Documentation and Access to Sources
inputs.help: 1) Methods or procedures for accessing data sources and 2) any special permissions needed for access

inputs.name: journalVolumeIssue
inputs.label: Journal
inputs.help: Indicates the volume, issue and date of a journal, which this Dataset is associated with.

inputs.name: journalArticleType
inputs.label: Type of Article
inputs.help: Indicates what kind of article this is, for example, a research article, a commentary, a book or product review, a case report, a calendar, etc (based on JATS).

inputs.name: geographicCoverage
inputs.label: Geographic Coverage
inputs.help: Information on the geographic coverage of the data. Includes the total geographic scope of the data.

inputs.name: geographicUnit
inputs.label: Geographic Unit
inputs.help: Lowest level of geographic aggregation covered by the Dataset, e.g., village, county, region.

inputs.name: geographicBoundingBox
inputs.label: Geographic Bounding Box
inputs.help: The fundamental geometric description for any Dataset that models geography is the geographic bounding box. It describes the minimum box, defined by west and east longitudes and north and south latitudes, which includes the largest geographic extent of the  Dataset's geographic coverage. This element is used in the first pass of a coordinate-based search. Inclusion of this element in the codebook is recommended, but is required if the bound polygon box is included.

inputs.name: unitOfAnalysis
inputs.label: Unit of Analysis
inputs.help: Basic unit of analysis or observation that this Dataset describes, such as individuals, families/households, groups, institutions/organizations, administrative units, and more. For information about the DDI's controlled vocabulary for this element, please refer to the DDI web page at http://www.ddialliance.org/controlled-vocabularies.

inputs.name: universe
inputs.label: Universe
inputs.help: Description of the population covered by the data in the file; the group of people or other elements that are the object of the study and to which the study results refer. Age, nationality, and residence commonly help to  delineate a given universe, but any number of other factors may be used, such as age limits, sex, marital status, race, ethnic group, nationality, income, veteran status, criminal convictions, and more. The universe may consist of elements other than persons, such as housing units, court cases, deaths, countries, and so on. In general, it should be possible to tell from the description of the universe whether a given individual or element is a member of the population under study. Also known as the universe of interest, population of interest, and target population.

inputs.name: timeMethod
inputs.label: Time Method
inputs.help: The time method or time dimension of the data collection, such as panel, cross-sectional, trend, time- series, or other.

inputs.name: dataCollector
inputs.label: Data Collector
inputs.help: Individual, agency or organization responsible for  administering the questionnaire or interview or compiling the data.

inputs.name: collectorTraining
inputs.label: Collector Training
inputs.help: Type of training provided to the data collector

inputs.name: frequencyOfDataCollection
inputs.label: Frequency
inputs.help: If the data collected includes more than one point in time, indicate the frequency with which the data was collected; that is, monthly, quarterly, or other.

inputs.name: samplingProcedure
inputs.label: Sampling Procedure
inputs.help: Type of sample and sample design used to select the survey respondents to represent the population. May include reference to the target sample size and the sampling fraction.

inputs.name: targetSampleSize
inputs.label: Target Sample Size
inputs.help: Specific information regarding the target sample size, actual  sample size, and the formula used to determine this.

inputs.name: deviationsFromSampleDesign
inputs.label: Major Deviations for Sample Design
inputs.help: Show correspondence as well as discrepancies between the sampled units (obtained) and available statistics for the population (age, sex-ratio, marital status, etc.) as a whole.

inputs.name: collectionMode
inputs.label: Collection Mode
inputs.help: Method used to collect the data; instrumentation characteristics (e.g., telephone interview, mail questionnaire, or other).

inputs.name: researchInstrument
inputs.label: Type of Research Instrument
inputs.help: Type of data collection instrument used. Structured indicates an instrument in which all respondents are asked the same questions/tests, possibly with precoded answers. If a small portion of such a questionnaire includes open-ended questions, provide appropriate comments. Semi-structured indicates that the research instrument contains mainly open-ended questions. Unstructured indicates that in-depth interviews were conducted.

inputs.name: dataCollectionSituation
inputs.label: Characteristics of Data Collection Situation
inputs.help: Description of noteworthy aspects of the data collection situation. Includes information on factors such as cooperativeness of respondents, duration of interviews, number of call backs, or similar.

inputs.name: actionsToMinimizeLoss
inputs.label: Actions to Minimize Losses
inputs.help: Summary of actions taken to minimize data loss. Include information on actions such as follow-up visits, supervisory checks, historical matching, estimation, and so on.

inputs.name: controlOperations
inputs.label: Control Operations
inputs.help: Control OperationsMethods to facilitate data control performed by the primary investigator or by the data archive.

inputs.name: weighting
inputs.label: Weighting
inputs.help: The use of sampling procedures might make it necessary to apply weights to produce accurate statistical results. Describes the criteria for using weights in analysis of a collection. If a weighting formula or coefficient was developed, the formula is provided, its elements are defined, and it is indicated how the formula was applied to the data.

inputs.name: cleaningOperations
inputs.label: Cleaning Operations
inputs.help: Methods used to clean the data collection, such as consistency checking, wildcode checking, or other.

inputs.name: datasetLevelErrorNotes
inputs.label: Study Level Error Notes
inputs.help: Note element used for any information annotating or clarifying the methodology and processing of the study.

inputs.name: responseRate
inputs.label: Response Rate
inputs.help: Percentage of sample members who provided information.

inputs.name: samplingErrorEstimates
inputs.label: Estimates of Sampling Error
inputs.help: Measure of how precisely one can estimate a population value from a given sample.

inputs.name: otherDataAppraisal
inputs.label: Other Forms of Data Appraisal
inputs.help: Other issues pertaining to the data appraisal. Describe issues such as response variance, nonresponse rate  and testing for bias, interviewer and response bias, confidence levels, question bias, or similar.

inputs.name: socialScienceNotes
inputs.label: Notes
inputs.help: General notes about this Dataset.

inputs.name: astroType
inputs.label: Type
inputs.help: The nature or genre of the content of the files in the dataset.

inputs.name: astroFacility
inputs.label: Facility
inputs.help: The observatory or facility where the data was obtained.

inputs.name: astroInstrument
inputs.label: Instrument
inputs.help: The instrument used to collect the data.

inputs.name: astroObject
inputs.label: Object
inputs.help: Astronomical Objects represented in the data (Given as SIMBAD recognizable names preferred).

inputs.name: resolution:Spatial
inputs.label: Spatial Resolution
inputs.help: The spatial (angular) resolution that is typical of the observations, in decimal degrees.

inputs.name: resolution:Spectral
inputs.label: Spectral Resolution
inputs.help: The spectral resolution that is typical of the observations, given as the ratio \u03bb/\u0394\u03bb.

inputs.name: resolution:Temporal
inputs.label: Time Resolution
inputs.help: The temporal resolution that is typical of the observations, given in seconds.

inputs.name: coverage:Spectral:Bandpass
inputs.label: Bandpass
inputs.help: Conventional bandpass name

inputs.name: coverage:Spectral:CentralWavelength
inputs.label: Central Wavelength (m)
inputs.help: The central wavelength of the spectral bandpass, in meters.

inputs.name: coverage:Spectral:Wavelength
inputs.label: Wavelength Range
inputs.help: The minimum and maximum wavelength of the spectral bandpass.

inputs.name: coverage:Temporal
inputs.label: Dataset Date Range
inputs.help: Time period covered by the data.

inputs.name: coverage:Spatial
inputs.label: Sky Coverage
inputs.help: The sky coverage of the data object.

inputs.name: coverage:Depth
inputs.label: Depth Coverage
inputs.help: The (typical) depth coverage, or sensitivity, of the data object in Jy.

inputs.name: coverage:ObjectDensity
inputs.label: Object Density
inputs.help: The (typical) density of objects, catalog entries, telescope pointings, etc., on the sky, in number per square degree.

inputs.name: coverage:ObjectCount
inputs.label: Object Count
inputs.help: The total number of objects, catalog entries, etc., in the data object.

inputs.name: coverage:SkyFraction
inputs.label: Fraction of Sky
inputs.help: The fraction of the sky represented in the observations, ranging from 0 to 1.

inputs.name: coverage:Polarization
inputs.label: Polarization
inputs.help: The polarization coverage

inputs.name: redshiftType
inputs.label: RedshiftType
inputs.help: RedshiftType string C "Redshift"; or "Optical" or "Radio" definitions of Doppler velocity used in the data object.

inputs.name: resolution:Redshift
inputs.label: Redshift Resolution
inputs.help: The resolution in redshift (unitless) or Doppler velocity (km/s) in the data object.

inputs.name: coverage:RedshiftValue
inputs.label: Redshift Value
inputs.help: The value of the redshift (unitless) or Doppler velocity (km/s in the data object.

inputs.name: studyDesignType
inputs.label: Design Type
inputs.help: Design types that are based on the overall experimental design.

inputs.name: studyOtherDesignType
inputs.label: Other Design Type
inputs.help: If Other was selected in Design Type, list any other design types that were used in this Dataset.

inputs.name: studyFactorType
inputs.label: Factor Type
inputs.help: Factors used in the Dataset.

inputs.name: studyOtherFactorType
inputs.label: Other Factor Type
inputs.help: If Other was selected in Factor Type, list any other factor types that were used in this Dataset.

inputs.name: studyAssayOrganism
inputs.label: Organism
inputs.help: The taxonomic name of the organism used in the Dataset or from which the  starting biological material derives.

inputs.name: studyAssayOtherOrganism
inputs.label: Other Organism
inputs.help: If Other was selected in Organism, list any other organisms that were used in this Dataset. Terms from the NCBI Taxonomy are recommended.

inputs.name: studyAssayMeasurementType
inputs.label: Measurement Type
inputs.help: A term to qualify the endpoint, or what is being measured (e.g. gene expression profiling; protein identification).

inputs.name: studyAssayOtherMeasurmentType
inputs.label: Other Measurement Type
inputs.help: If Other was selected in Measurement Type, list any other measurement types that were used. Terms from NCBO Bioportal are recommended.

inputs.name: studyAssayTechnologyType
inputs.label: Technology Type
inputs.help: A term to identify the technology used to perform the measurement (e.g. DNA microarray; mass spectrometry).
values: culture based drug susceptibility testing, single concentration
culture based drug susceptibility testing, two concentrations
culture based drug susceptibility testing, three or more concentrations (minimium inhibitory concentration measurement)

inputs.name: studyAssayOtherTechnologyType
inputs.label: Other Technology Type
inputs.help: If Other was selected in Technology Type, list any other technology types that were used in this Dataset.

inputs.name: studyAssayPlatform
inputs.label: Technology Platform
inputs.help: The manufacturer and name of the technology platform used in the assay (e.g. Bruker AVANCE).
values: Indirect proportion method on LJ medium
Indirect proportion method on Middlebrook Agar 7H9
Indirect proportion method on Middlebrook Agar 7H10
Indirect proportion method on Middlebrook Agar 7H11

inputs.name: studyAssayOtherPlatform
inputs.label: Other Technology Platform
inputs.help: If Other was selected in Technology Platform, list any other technology platforms that were used in this Dataset.

inputs.name: studyAssayCellType
inputs.label: Cell Type
inputs.help: The name of the cell line from which the source or sample derives.

inputs.name: contentSize
inputs.label: Content size
inputs.help: File size in bytes

inputs.name: encodingFormat
inputs.label: Encoding type
inputs.help: MIME type of file

inputs.name: description
inputs.label: Description
inputs.help: Description of the file's content

inputs.name: otherIdAgency
inputs.label: Agency
inputs.help: The name of the agency that generated the other identifier

inputs.name: otherIdValue
inputs.label: Identifier
inputs.help: Another identifier uniquely identifies the Dataset

otherId.label: Other Identifier
otherId.help: Another unique identifier for the Dataset (e.g. producer's or another repository's identifier)

inputs.name: authorName
inputs.label: Name
inputs.help: The name of the author, such as the person's name or the name of an organization

inputs.name: authorAffiliation
inputs.label: Affiliation
inputs.help: The name of the entity affiliated with the author, e.g. an organization's name

inputs.name: authorIdentifierScheme
inputs.label: Identifier Type
inputs.help: The type of identifier that uniquely identifies the author (e.g. ORCID, ISNI)

inputs.name: authorIdentifier
inputs.label: Identifier
inputs.help: Uniquely identifies the author when paired with an identifier type

author.label: Author
author.help: The entity, e.g. a person or organization, that created the Dataset

inputs.name: datasetContactName
inputs.label: Name
inputs.help: The name of the point of contact, e.g. the person's name or the name of an organization

inputs.name: datasetContactAffiliation
inputs.label: Affiliation
inputs.help: The name of the entity affiliated with the point of contact, e.g. an organization's name

inputs.name: datasetContactEmail
inputs.label: E-mail
inputs.help: The point of contact's email address

datasetContact.label: Point of Contact
datasetContact.help: The entity, e.g. a person or organization, that users of the Dataset can contact with questions

inputs.name: dsDescriptionValue
inputs.label: Text
inputs.help: A summary describing the purpose, nature, and scope of the Dataset

inputs.name: dsDescriptionDate
inputs.label: Date
inputs.help: The date when the description was added to the Dataset. If the Dataset contains more than one description, e.g. the data producer supplied one description and the data repository supplied another, this date is used to distinguish between the descriptions

dsDescription.label: Description
dsDescription.help: A summary describing the purpose, nature, and scope of the Dataset

inputs.name: keywordValue
inputs.label: Term
inputs.help: A key term that describes important aspects of the Dataset

inputs.name: keywordVocabulary
inputs.label: Controlled Vocabulary Name
inputs.help: The controlled vocabulary used for the keyword term (e.g. LCSH, MeSH)

inputs.name: keywordVocabularyURI
inputs.label: Controlled Vocabulary URL
inputs.help: The URL where one can access information about the term's controlled vocabulary

keyword.label: Keyword
keyword.help: A key term that describes an important aspect of the Dataset and information about any controlled vocabulary used

inputs.name: topicClassValue
inputs.label: Term
inputs.help: A topic or subject term

inputs.name: topicClassVocab
inputs.label: Controlled Vocabulary Name
inputs.help: The controlled vocabulary used for the keyword term (e.g. LCSH, MeSH)

inputs.name: topicClassVocabURI
inputs.label: Controlled Vocabulary URL
inputs.help: The URL where one can access information about the term's controlled vocabulary

topicClassification.label: Topic Classification
topicClassification.help: Indicates a broad, important topic or subject that the Dataset covers and information about any controlled vocabulary used

inputs.name: publicationCitation
inputs.label: Citation
inputs.help: The full bibliographic citation for the related publication

inputs.name: publicationIDType
inputs.label: Identifier Type
inputs.help: The type of identifier that uniquely identifies a related publication

inputs.name: publicationIDNumber
inputs.label: Identifier
inputs.help: The identifier for a related publication

inputs.name: publicationURL
inputs.label: URL
inputs.help: The URL form of the identifier entered in the Identifier field, e.g. the DOI URL if a DOI was entered in the Identifier field. Used to display what was entered in the ID Type and ID Number fields as a link. If what was entered in the Identifier field has no URL form, the URL of the publication webpage is used, e.g. a journal article webpage

publication.label: Related Publication
publication.help: The article or report that uses the data in the Dataset. The full list of related publications will be displayed on the metadata tab

inputs.name: producerName
inputs.label: Name
inputs.help: The name of the entity, e.g. the person's name or the name of an organization

inputs.name: producerAffiliation
inputs.label: Affiliation
inputs.help: The name of the entity affiliated with the producer, e.g. an organization's name

inputs.name: producerAbbreviation
inputs.label: Abbreviated Name
inputs.help: The producer's abbreviated name (e.g. IQSS, ICPSR)

inputs.name: producerURL
inputs.label: URL
inputs.help: The URL of the producer's website

inputs.name: producerLogoURL
inputs.label: Logo URL
inputs.help: The URL of the producer's logo

producer.label: Producer
producer.help: The entity, such a person or organization, managing the finances or other administrative processes involved in the creation of the Dataset

inputs.name: contributorType
inputs.label: Type
inputs.help: Indicates the type of contribution made to the dataset

inputs.name: contributorName
inputs.label: Name
inputs.help: The name of the contributor, e.g. the person's name or the name of an organization

contributor.label: Contributor
contributor.help: The entity, such as a person or organization, responsible for collecting, managing, or otherwise contributing to the development of the Dataset

inputs.name: grantNumberAgency
inputs.label: Agency
inputs.help: The agency that provided financial support for the Dataset

inputs.name: grantNumberValue
inputs.label: Identifier
inputs.help: The grant identifier or contract identifier of the agency that provided financial support for the Dataset

grantNumber.label: Funding Information
grantNumber.help: Information about the Dataset's financial support

inputs.name: distributorName
inputs.label: Name
inputs.help: The name of the entity, e.g. the person's name or the name of an organization

inputs.name: distributorAffiliation
inputs.label: Affiliation
inputs.help: The name of the entity affiliated with the distributor, e.g. an organization's name

inputs.name: distributorAbbreviation
inputs.label: Abbreviated Name
inputs.help: The distributor's abbreviated name (e.g. IQSS, ICPSR)

inputs.name: distributorURL
inputs.label: URL
inputs.help: The URL of the distributor's webpage

inputs.name: distributorLogoURL
inputs.label: Logo URL
inputs.help: The URL of the distributor's logo image, used to show the image on the Dataset's page

distributor.label: Distributor
distributor.help: The entity, such as a person or organization, designated to generate copies of the Dataset, including any editions or revisions

inputs.name: timePeriodCoveredStart
inputs.label: Start Date
inputs.help: The start date of the time period that the data refer to

inputs.name: timePeriodCoveredEnd
inputs.label: End Date
inputs.help: The end date of the time period that the data refer to

timePeriodCovered.label: Time Period
timePeriodCovered.help: The time period that the data refer to. Also known as span. This is the time period covered by the data, not the dates of coding, collecting data, or making documents machine-readable

inputs.name: dateOfCollectionStart
inputs.label: Start Date
inputs.help: The date when the data collection started

inputs.name: dateOfCollectionEnd
inputs.label: End Date
inputs.help: The date when the data collection ended

dateOfCollection.label: Date of Collection
dateOfCollection.help: The dates when the data were collected or generated

inputs.name: seriesName
inputs.label: Name
inputs.help: The name of the dataset series

inputs.name: seriesInformation
inputs.label: Information
inputs.help: Can include 1) a history of the series and 2) a summary of features that apply to the series

series.label: Series
series.help: Information about the dataset series to which the Dataset belong

inputs.name: softwareName
inputs.label: Name
inputs.help: The name of software used to generate the Dataset

inputs.name: softwareVersion
inputs.label: Version
inputs.help: The version of the software used to generate the Dataset, e.g. 4.11

software.label: Software
software.help: Information about the software used to generate the Dataset

inputs.name: journalVolume
inputs.label: Volume
inputs.help: The journal volume which this Dataset is associated with (e.g., Volume 4).

inputs.name: journalIssue
inputs.label: Issue
inputs.help: The journal issue number which this Dataset is associated with (e.g., Number 2, Autumn).

inputs.name: journalPubDate
inputs.label: Publication Date
inputs.help: The publication date for this journal volume/issue, which this Dataset is associated with (e.g., 1999).

journalVolumeIssue.label: Journal
journalVolumeIssue.help: Indicates the volume, issue and date of a journal, which this Dataset is associated with.

inputs.name: country
inputs.label: Country / Nation
inputs.help: The country or nation that the Dataset is about.
values: Congo, the Democratic Republic of the
Macedonia, the Former Yugoslav Republic of
Saint Helena, Ascension and Tristan da Cunha
South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

inputs.name: state
inputs.label: State / Province
inputs.help: The state or province that the Dataset is about. Use GeoNames for correct spelling and avoid abbreviations.

inputs.name: city
inputs.label: City
inputs.help: The name of the city that the Dataset is about. Use GeoNames for correct spelling and avoid abbreviations.

inputs.name: otherGeographicCoverage
inputs.label: Other
inputs.help: Other information on the geographic coverage of the data.

geographicCoverage.label: Geographic Coverage
geographicCoverage.help: Information on the geographic coverage of the data. Includes the total geographic scope of the data.

inputs.name: westLongitude
inputs.label: West Longitude
inputs.help: Westernmost coordinate delimiting the geographic extent of the Dataset. A valid range of values,  expressed in decimal degrees, is -180,0 <= West  Bounding Longitude Value <= 180,0.

inputs.name: eastLongitude
inputs.label: East Longitude
inputs.help: Easternmost coordinate delimiting the geographic extent of the Dataset. A valid range of values,  expressed in decimal degrees, is -180,0 <= East Bounding Longitude Value <= 180,0.

inputs.name: northLongitude
inputs.label: North Latitude
inputs.help: Northernmost coordinate delimiting the geographic extent of the Dataset. A valid range of values,  expressed in decimal degrees, is -90,0 <= North Bounding Latitude Value <= 90,0.

inputs.name: southLongitude
inputs.label: South Latitude
inputs.help: Southernmost coordinate delimiting the geographic extent of the Dataset. A valid range of values,  expressed in decimal degrees, is -90,0 <= South Bounding Latitude Value <= 90,0.

geographicBoundingBox.label: Geographic Bounding Box
geographicBoundingBox.help: The fundamental geometric description for any Dataset that models geography is the geographic bounding box. It describes the minimum box, defined by west and east longitudes and north and south latitudes, which includes the largest geographic extent of the  Dataset's geographic coverage. This element is used in the first pass of a coordinate-based search. Inclusion of this element in the codebook is recommended, but is required if the bound polygon box is included.

inputs.name: targetSampleActualSize
inputs.label: Actual
inputs.help: Actual sample size.

inputs.name: targetSampleSizeFormula
inputs.label: Formula
inputs.help: Formula used to determine target sample size.

targetSampleSize.label: Target Sample Size
targetSampleSize.help: Specific information regarding the target sample size, actual  sample size, and the formula used to determine this.

inputs.name: socialScienceNotesType
inputs.label: Type
inputs.help: Type of note.

inputs.name: socialScienceNotesSubject
inputs.label: Subject
inputs.help: Note subject.

inputs.name: socialScienceNotesText
inputs.label: Text
inputs.help: Text for this note.

inputs.name: coverage:Spectral:MinimumWavelength
inputs.label: Minimum (m)
inputs.help: The minimum wavelength of the spectral bandpass, in meters.

inputs.name: coverage:Spectral:MaximumWavelength
inputs.label: Maximum (m)
inputs.help: The maximum wavelength of the spectral bandpass, in meters.

coverage:Spectral:Wavelength.label: Wavelength Range
coverage:Spectral:Wavelength.help: The minimum and maximum wavelength of the spectral bandpass.

inputs.name: coverage:Temporal:StartTime
inputs.label: Start
inputs.help: Dataset Start Date

inputs.name: coverage:Temporal:StopTime
inputs.label: End
inputs.help: Dataset End Date

coverage:Temporal.label: Dataset Date Range
coverage:Temporal.help: Time period covered by the data.

inputs.name: coverage:Redshift:MinimumValue
inputs.label: Minimum
inputs.help: The minimum value of the redshift (unitless) or Doppler velocity (km/s in the data object.

inputs.name: coverage:Redshift:MaximumValue
inputs.label: Maximum
inputs.help: The maximum value of the redshift (unitless) or Doppler velocity (km/s in the data object.

coverage:RedshiftValue.label: Redshift Value
coverage:RedshiftValue.help: The value of the redshift (unitless) or Doppler velocity (km/s in the data object.
